In a bowl, let the glutinous rice (sticky rice) soak in cold water overnight. The rice will absorb a good deal of water. Drain the excess before assembling.

Submerge the bamboo leaves for 30 minutes until soft. Rinse under cold water to remove the dirt. Transfer the bamboo leaves to a large pot of boiling water and let them simmer for at least 10 minutes or until the leaves are green fully rehydrated.
To assemble the zongzi, take two bamboo leaves pointing in opposite directions and overlap the leaves by 80%.
Fold the leaves toward you to form a cone shape.
Pack 2 tbsp of glutinous rice to the bottom of the cone
Place a tbsp full of red bean paste on top of the rice.
Add another 2 tbsp of glutinous rice to completely cover the red bean paste. Gently push the top to make sure the surface is flat.
Fold over the leaves to cover the top completely.
Fold the remaining part of the leaves either to the right or left side. The zongzi should be completely wrapped.
Use a string to bind the zongzi so the leaves donâ€™t unfold. Repeat the same process until you finish either the rice or red bean paste.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the zongzi and let boil over low heat for 90-120 minutes. Remove the leaves and serve while hot.
A sweet sticky rice dumpling with red bean paste which only requires 3 ingredients.
